channel.title: Love + Radio
channel.description: Nick van der Kolk's Love and Radio features in-depth, otherworldly-produced interviews with an eclectic range of subjects, from the seedy to the sublime. Get inside the mind of a rogue taxidermist. Find out what it's like to experience a stroke firsthand. Or spend time with an artist who gives away her life savings every night. You've never heard anything like it before. Powered by PRX's Radiotopia.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Listen with your headphones on. Powered by Radiotopia.
channel.itunes:author: Love and Radio
channel.itunes:summary: Nick van der Kolk's Love and Radio features intimate and otherworldly-produced interviews with an eclectic range of subjects, from the seedy to the sublime. Powered by Radiotopia.

item.title: Of Birds and Boundaries
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: An eruv is a ritual enclosure that allows religious Jews to negate rules against carrying certain objects (like housekeys or strollers) during the Sabbath. This conversation is not about that.
item.itunes:subtitle: An eruv is a ritual enclosure that allows religio…
item.description: An eruv is a ritual enclosure that allows religious Jews to negate rules against carrying certain objects (like housekeys or strollers) during the Sabbath. This conversation is not about that.
item.author: contact@loveandradio.org (Love and Radio)

item.title: Choir Boy
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: Tom Justice is passionate about cycling, and was on the shortlist for the US Olympic Team. Also, he's a bank robber.

item.title: Sesquipedalian
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: Charles Farrell was born to a sophisticated middle class family in Boston, but at age 12, he left home and came of age on the street, joining “low-life culture”, the underbelly of boxing, and avant garde piano.
item.itunes:subtitle: Charles Farrell was born to a sophisticated middl…
item.description: Charles Farrell was born to a sophisticated middle class family in Boston, but at age 12, he left home and came of age on the street, joining “low-life culture”, the underbelly of boxing, and avant garde piano.

item.title: I, Sitting Beside Me
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: In 1987, during the last years of the Cold War, a West German teenager with only about 50 hours of flying experience rented a Cessna and departed on a two week trip. His goal was to fly over the Iron Curtain and land in Moscow.
item.itunes:subtitle: In 1987, during the last years of the Cold War, a…
item.description: In 1987, during the last years of the Cold War, a West German teenager with only about 50 hours of flying experience rented a Cessna and departed on a two week trip. His goal was to fly over the Iron Curtain and land in Moscow.
item.author: contact@loveandradio.org (Love and Radio)

item.title: Hostile Planet
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: We think of certain events as profoundly life-altering. Getting married or emigrating to a new country, say. But you can always get divorced, and you can almost always move back. Taylor is weighing a life decision from which there would be no turning back.
item.itunes:subtitle: We think of certain events as profoundly life-alt…
item.description: We think of certain events as profoundly life-altering. Getting married or emigrating to a new country, say. But you can always get divorced, and you can almost always move back. Taylor is weighing a life decision from which there would be no turning back.
item.author: contact@loveandradio.org (Love and Radio)

item.title: Another Planet
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: The true story of Clyde Casey, a street performer who used surrealism and abstract art to fight crime in Los Angeles' Skid Row in the 1980s, and the creator of a place called Another Planet. Also featuring the voices of Tim Robbins (yes, THAT Tim Robbins), Lonnie Johnson, Flame Simon, and Richard Haxton.
item.itunes:subtitle: The true story of Clyde Casey, a street performer…
item.description: The true story of Clyde Casey, a street performer who used surrealism and abstract art to fight crime in Los Angeles' Skid Row in the 1980s, and the creator of a place called Another Planet. Also featuring the voices of Tim Robbins (yes, THAT Tim Robbins), Lonnie Johnson, Flame Simon, and Richard Haxton.
item.author: contact@loveandradio.org (Love and Radio)

item.title: The Superchat

item.title: Jack and Ellen
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary:
Hey kids, this interview isn't for you. You should skip this one.
Ellen was struggling for money, working as a Subway "sandwich artist" (yes, that's a real thing). So she decided to find a new job, and settled on one that allowed her to make over $30,000 for just a couple hours of work each week. One with emotional and moral consequences she didn't fully anticipate.
Produced by Mooj Zadie, Brendan Baker, and Nick van der Kolk, with help from Mark Ristich, Sharon Mashihi, Rachel James, Matthew Kielty, and Lingling Yang.
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey kids, this interview isn't for you. You shoul…
item.description: Hey kids, this interview isn't for you. You should skip this one. Ellen was struggling for money, working as a Subway "sandwich artist" (yes, that's a real thing). So she decided to find a new job, and settled on one that allowed her to make over $30,000 for just a couple hours of work each week. One with emotional and moral consequences she didn't fully anticipate. Produced by Mooj Zadie, Brendan Baker, and Nick van der Kolk, with help from Mark Ristich, Sharon Mashihi, Rachel James, Matthew Kielty, and Lingling Yang.
item.author: contact@loveandradio.org (Love and Radio)

item.title: Greenberg's War
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: Lewis Greenberg is an artist unlike any other, a winner of the coveted Geezer of the Year award, and a man on a mission--much to the chagrin of his Ballwin, Missouri neighbors.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lewis Greenberg is an artist unlike any other, a …
item.description: Lewis Greenberg is an artist unlike any other, a winner of the coveted Geezer of the Year award, and a man on a mission--much to the chagrin of his Ballwin, Missouri neighbors.

item.title: Seventy Weeks
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: Andre Taylor identified strongly with Daniel from the Bible, who interpreted the visions and dreams of kings. And like Daniel, he spent 3 years in a Babylonian captivity of sorts. But Daniel never had quite the unorthodox career path of Andre.
item.itunes:subtitle: Andre Taylor identified strongly with Daniel from…
item.description: Andre Taylor identified strongly with Daniel from the Bible, who interpreted the visions and dreams of kings. And like Daniel, he spent 3 years in a Babylonian captivity of sorts. But Daniel never had quite the unorthodox career path of Andre.
item.author: contact@loveandradio.org (Love and Radio)

item.title: Fix
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: A crusader for truth, or, as Karl Rove called him: "a nut with internet access"? Jason Leopold wanted to be a part of something, and that quest brought him through a labyrinthine world of decadent glam metal, dangerous mafioso, love, and investigative journalism challenging the heights of government and corporate power.
item.itunes:subtitle: A crusader for truth, or, as Karl Rove called him…

item.title: The Man in the Road
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: On a late night along an empty Utah highway, Melvin Dummar says he came across a bloodied man lying by the road. It’s cliched to say this, but it’s really true: the story of that discovery would profoundly alter the course of his life forever.

item.title: The Businesswoman
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary:
"I don't know you and you don't know me," I said. "I could tell you any secret and it wouldn't matter."
"It's funny you should mention that," she said, "because I've got a secret I've only told my closest friend."
item.itunes:subtitle: "I don't know you and you don't know me," I said.…

item.title: Get Me Away From Here
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: Stories about escape and rescue. Katie escapes to and away from one faction of the tradition known as the Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn. Jenny Asarnow looks to Julie the Amtrak God to get away from it all. Adrianne has rescue fantasies. Ben Popik of Olde English moves in with his girlfriend. They're in love, it's going to be great. Josh Cole is buried in lots and lots and lots of snow. Kerry Seed of The Local Option dodges an untimely death via bear.
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories about escape and rescue. Katie escapes to…

item.title: Flip Yr Sh!t
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: Stories about anger. Adam Allington (edited by producer Kerry Seed) hates Tim Hortons. Julian James gets in deep shit with the vice principal. Adrianne learns how to swear in middle school. Shig the Unmentionable tells us to PUT THAT DOWN. Ben Popik of Olde English gets a coworker of his fired. Lev and his girlfriend try to rent a movie and enter a swirling emotional maelstrom of relationship doom. Lev’s story is from his excellent online comic Tales of Mere Existence. Check out the original version of Conversation at his website, (http://www.ingredientx.com/) along with the pretty drawrings that go along with it, and other stories that are sure to depress the shit out of you (in a good way).
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories about anger. Adam Allington (edited by pr…
item.description: Stories about anger. Adam Allington (edited by producer Kerry Seed) hates Tim Hortons. Julian James gets in deep shit with the vice principal. Adrianne learns how to swear in middle school. Shig the Unmentionable tells us to PUT THAT DOWN. Ben Popik of Olde English gets a coworker of his fired. Lev and his girlfriend try to rent a movie and enter a swirling emotional maelstrom of relationship doom. Lev’s story is from his excellent online comic Tales of Mere Existence. Check out the original version of Conversation at his website, (http://www.ingredientx.com/) along with the pretty drawrings that go along with it, and other stories that are sure to depress the shit out of you (in a good way).

item.title: Love in Bits
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: Stories from the World of Online Dating. Christian Rudder of OKCupid.com describes how he knows everything about what kind of lover you are. Aaron Henkin of WYPR’s The Signal reads a sample of the OKCupid Love Personality Types. Eric Herot flies down to Missouri to meet a Bajoran he met on a Star Trek simming board. Christina H meets up with some dude from craigslist. Bitch PHD describes the gender dynamics of an Adult Friend Finder chatroom. Christian Rudder explains how to tell if a boy likes you. Adam Conover of sketch comedy group Olde English discovers that girls really like to be told they’re secret agents. And finally, Christina’s leaves a businessman from Israel very frustrated.
item.itunes:subtitle: Stories from the World of Online Dating. Christia…
item.description: Stories from the World of Online Dating. Christian Rudder of OKCupid.com describes how he knows everything about what kind of lover you are. item.title: Ghost Stories
item.itunes:author: Love + Radio
item.itunes:summary: Exploring the Frankenstein Family Crypt in 1952. Paranormal observations by an eight-year-old. The haunting of an unkind kitty, a discussion of the ghost story structure, and a very scary pantry door. This episode features contributions from Michael Kraskin of Catalogue of Ships. Also a spooky story from Hans Anderson.
